history.proof: intros H. apply filter_ext_in_iff. intros x Hx. sfirstorder depth: 3.

exceptions.exn: Cannot find an homogeneous relation to rewrite.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
q: X -> bool
p: X -> bool
A: list X

Goal:
(forall x, x el A -> p x = q x) -> filter p A = filter q A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
filter_pq_mono : forall p q A, (forall x, x el A -> p x -> q x) -> filter p A <<= filter q A
filter_id : forall p A, (forall x, x el A -> p x) -> filter p A = A
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, a el ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type] ?B : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type] ?f : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- list ?A]
cfind : forall (A0 : list ?X) (p0 : ?X -> Prop), (forall x : ?X, dec (p0 x)) -> {x : ?X | x el A0 /\ p0 x} + {forall x : ?X, x el A0 -> ~ p0 x} where ?X : [X : Type p : X -> bool q : X -> bool A : list X |- Type]
list_cc : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (A : list X), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> (exists x : X, x el A /\ p x) -> {x : X | x el A /\ p x}
filter_fst : forall p x A, p x -> filter p (x :: A) = x :: filter p A
filter_fst' : forall p x A, ~ p x -> filter p (x :: A) = filter p A
list_exists_DM : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> ~ (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ p x) -> exists x : X, x el A /\ p x
list_forall_dec : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> dec (forall x : X, x el A -> p x)
list_exists_dec : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> dec (exists x : X, x el A /\ p x)
filter_mono : forall p A B, A <<= B -> filter p A <<= filter p B
filter_app : forall p A B, filter p (A ++ B) = filter p A ++ filter p B
in_filter_iff : forall x p A, x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x
disjoint : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop
equi : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
filter_ext_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a)
filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l
inclp : forall X : Type, list X -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop
dec_DN : forall X : Prop, dec X -> ~ ~ X -> X
ZMicromega.vars = fix vars (jmp : positive) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) {struct p} : list positive := match p with | EnvRing.Pc _ => [] | EnvRing.Pinj j p0 => vars (j + jmp)%positive p0 | EnvRing.PX p0 _ q => jmp :: vars jmp p0 ++ vars (Pos.succ jmp) q end : positive -> EnvRing.Pol Z -> list positive Arguments ZMicromega.vars _%positive_scope
ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a
filter_incl : forall p A, filter p A <<= A
RingMicromega.Psatz_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : RingMicromega.Psatz C -> Prop), (forall n : nat, P (RingMicromega.PsatzIn C n)) -> (forall p : RingMicromega.PolC C, P (RingMicromega.PsatzSquare p)) -> (forall (p : RingMicromega.PolC C) (p0 : RingMicromega.Psatz C), P p0 -> P (RingMicromega.PsatzMulC p p0)) -> (forall p : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p -> forall p0 : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p0 -> P (RingMicromega.PsatzMulE p p0)) ->...-> forall p : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p
List.filter_app : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l' : list A), filter f (l ++ l') = filter f l ++ filter f l'

```coq
intros H.
apply filter_ext_in_iff.
intros x Hx.
rewrite Hx.
apply H.
Qed.
```

original: intros H. apply filter_ext_in_iff. intros x Hx. rewrite Hx. apply H.
